channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Y Combinator Just Released Its Latest Startup Wishlist. Here’s Every Idea It Has for Founders
item.description: The accelerator’s new ‘Requests for Startups’ covers everything from AI hedge funds to advanced metal mills.

item.title: Over a million people are losing power during a freezing snowstorm while data centers nearby guzzle electricity
item.description: The terms of data center agreements with local governments and utilities often aren’t available to the public.

item.title: Inside the Minneapolis restaurant that has stopped charging for food until ICE leaves the city
item.description: February is always difficult in Minneapolis . It’s when the nerve-flaying cold of December and January starts to seem like a dress rehearsal. But this...

item.title: S&P rings up 5th loss in 6 days as tech stocks drag index down, led by AMD’s 17.3% drop
item.description: More than twice as many stocks rose within the S&P 500 than fell, but sinking technology stocks weighed on the index for a second straight day.

item.title: Short-seller claims IonQ, the biggest quantum computing company on the stock market, failed to disclose holes in its revenue
item.description: Short-seller Wolfpack Research says IonQ misled investors about cancelled government earmarks; it also points to suspicious insider stock sales.

item.title: Why the U.S. Olympic Team Quietly Renamed Its ‘Ice House’—and What It Reveals About Modern Brand Risk
item.description: How cultural forces can make everyday language unusable and what brands must do to keep up.

item.title: Some renters should be wary of ‘rent now, pay later’ services. Here’s why
item.description: Rent can eat up an entire paycheck at the start of the month, so a growing number of renters are turning to a financial product that promises relief b...

item.title: Google parent Alphabet predicts a sharp surge in 2026 capital spending on AI
item.description: Alphabet said on Wednesday it was targeting capital expenditure of $175 billion to $185 billion this year, in yet another aggressive ramp-up in spendi...

item.title: Here’s What This 82-Year-Old Ultramarathoner Can Teach Us About Aging
item.description: His fitness levels match those of healthy men in their twenties.

item.title: Pizza Hut will close 250 ‘underperforming’ locations in 2026 as list of struggling restaurants grows
item.description: Pizza Hut is closing hundreds of “underperforming” locations nationwide, according to parent company Yum! Brands, which reported fourth-quarter 2025 e...

item.title: Why Bad Bunny is essential to the future of the NFL, even if Trump hates his halftime show
item.description: Unlike the NBA, the NFL doesn't have international markets already familiar with its game to expand into.

item.title: Doritos, Lays, Cheetos, and more popular snacks are getting a major discount ahead of the Super Bowl
item.description: Just in time for the Super Bowl, PepsiCo is cutting the price of Doritos, Cheetos, Lay’s, Tostitos, and other snacks by up to 15%. The move comes afte...

item.title: From ‘Operation Dirtbag’ to ‘Catch of the Day,’ Trump’s ICE nicknames ripped as ‘disgusting’ and ‘subhuman’
item.description: From operation "Swamp Sweep" to detention facilities like "Alligator Alcatraz," scholars say immigration operation names represent a "victory dance."

item.title: 5 Startup Lessons That Helped Wonderbelly Land a Nine‑Figure Exit
item.description: The brothers behind Wonderbelly didn’t have a background in CPG or wellness, but they had a personal story and a vision.
